DOC.brief_summary: In this study the investigators wish to compare the effect of a selective axillary nerve block to placebo in patients undergoing arthroscopic shoulder surgery. It is the investigators hypothesis that the amount of morphine consumption in the first 4 hours postoperatively in the intervention group will be significant lower than in the placebo group.
DOC.brief_title: Selective Block of the Axillary Nerve in Postoperative Pain Management
DOC.criteria: Subjects undergoing arthroscopic shoulder surgery Age between 18 and 80 years ASA 13 BMI between 18 and 35 kg/m2 Subjects which have given their written informed consent Subjects unable to cooperate to the investigation Subjects not understanding or speaking danish Subjects allergic to intervention drugs Daily use of strong analgesics (morphine, oxycontine, ketogan) Alcohol or medicine misuse Failure of nerve block
